sentence.Network_en: He estimate his income tax bill by extrapolation from figures submit in previous year.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从前几年的报税数字推算出自己应缴的所得税数额.

sentence.Network_en: His estimate of half a million HIV positive cases was based on an extrapolation of the known incidence of the virus.
sentence.Network_cn: 他估计有50万个HIV阳性病例，这是根据已知的病毒感染率作出的推论。

sentence.Network_en: Rather, speculation, conflicts, and theoretical extrapolation typify their every action.
sentence.Network_cn: 相反, 怀疑 、 冲突和理论上的推断是他们每步行为的特征.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 6、外推法（extrapolation）：根据一组，计算观测范围以外同一对象近似值的方法，称外推法。中常用这种方法，即根据已知部分的地质规律.

entry.def: If you extrapolate from known facts, you use them as a basis for general statements about a situation or about what is likely to happen in the future.

example.ex: Extrapolating from his American findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking...
example.tran: 根据他在美国的调查结果推断，他估计这些人中约有80％可能死于吸烟。

example.ex: It is unhelpful to extrapolate general trends from one case.
example.tran: 根据一个案例来推断总的趋势是没有用的。

means.word_mean: 1. (mathematics) calculation of the value of a function outside the range of known values
2. an inference about the future (or about some hypothetical situation) based on known facts and observations

auth_sentence.content: Macro evolution is a HUGE extrapolation of micro evolution.
